visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing quarterly performance trends using synthetic data with a positive trend and seasonal variation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 10 quarterly observations of enterprise sales revenue (continuous numerical variable) across 2.5 fiscal years (ordinal categorical variable). Synthetic data follows a compound growth pattern (μ=84.3, σ=38.9) with seasonal Q4 dips (-15% from trend), simulating real-world business cycles. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating unnecessary gridlines while maintaining Cairo's proportional ink principle through consistent bar widths. Cool-toned color palette (#2c7be5) ensures preattentive processing of quantitative differences, with y-axis gridlines in #eceff4 maintaining chart structure without visual competition. Trend annotations follow Tufte's principle of adjacent documentation by placing legend in data-proximate top-right position.
